identificationModule.briefTitle: Abdominal Nerve Blockade in Chronic Heart Failure.
identificationModule.officialTitle: Splanchnic Nerve Blockade in Chronic Heart Failure. Splanchnic CHF

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Patients with chronic heart failure and undergoing right heart catheterization will be enrolled in this study. Subjects will undergo catheterization of the heart to obtain central cardiac pressure and other cardiac hemodynamic parameters. Subsequently, the subject will undergo a regional nerve block of the splanchnic nerves.

This study will be a prospective, uncontrolled clinical trial. The study will not be controlled as invasive monitoring of hemodynamics will be performed, allowing clear demonstration of a cause-effect relationship. The goal of the study is to provide proof of concept.

Patients will undergo detailed physiological testing.

armGroups.label: Regional nerve anesthesia
interventionNames: Drug: splanchnic nerve anesthesia with a local anesthetic

interventions.name: splanchnic nerve anesthesia with a local anesthetic
interventions.description: regional nerve block with a local anesthetic (Lidocaine/Bupivacaine)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Exercise Capacity as Measured by Peak Oxygen Uptake (Peak VO2)
primaryOutcomes.description: Peak VO2 will be measured before and after nerve block.
Mean pulmonary arterial pressure will be measured before and after nerve block.
Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure will be measured at 20 Watts steady state and peak exercise.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Cardiac index will be measured at 20 Watts steady state and peak exercise. Cardiac index (CI) is a haemodynamic parameter that relates the cardiac output (CO) from left ventricle in one minute to body surface area (BSA), thus relating heart performance to the size of the individual.
Urine output will be measured in the 2 hours before the nerve block and in the 2 hours afterwards
BUN (blood urea nitrogen) and creatinine levels will be measured in the 2 hours before the nerve block and in the 2 hours afterwards.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of heart failure (HF)
* Symptomatic with dyspnea
* On a stable HF drug regimen

Exclusion Criteria:

* Ongoing treatment with oral anticoagulation other than aspirin
* Immunosuppressive medications for solid organ transplant
* Acute MI (STEMI or Type I NSTEMI) within 7 days
* Systolic blood pressure \< 90 mmHg or \>180 mmHg
* Infiltrative cardiomyopathy or constrictive cardiomyopathy
* Chronic kidney disease stage 5
* Pregnancy

references.citation: Fudim M, Patel MR, Boortz-Marx R, Borlaug BA, DeVore AD, Ganesh A, Green CL, Lopes RD, Mentz RJ, Patel CB, Rogers JG, Felker GM, Hernandez AF, Sunagawa K, Burkhoff D. Splanchnic Nerve Block Mediated Changes in Stressed Blood Volume in Heart Failure. JACC Heart Fail. 2021 Apr;9(4):293-300. doi: 10.1016/j.jchf.2020.12.006. Epub 2021 Mar 10.

Fudim M, Boortz-Marx RL, Ganesh A, DeVore AD, Patel CB, Rogers JG, Coburn A, Johnson I, Paul A, Coyne BJ, Rao SV, Gutierrez JA, Kiefer TL, Kong DF, Green CL, Jones WS, Felker GM, Hernandez AF, Patel MR. Splanchnic Nerve Block for Chronic Heart Failure. JACC Heart Fail. 2020 Sep;8(9):742-752. doi: 10.1016/j.jchf.2020.04.010. Epub 2020 Jun 10.

eventGroups.title: Splanchnic Nerve Block
eventGroups.description: Splanchnic nerve anesthesia with a local anesthetic: regional nerve block with a local anesthetic (Lidocaine/Ropivacaine)

otherEvents.notes: The first five patients had bilateral SNB and four of them developed symptomatic orthostatic hypotension (systolic blood pressure drop \>20mmHg with 5 min standing). In all cases the orthostatic hypotension resolved with oral or intravenous hydration
